candidate: A 32-year-old woman has been referred by her GP because of persistent low mood, early morning waking, and loss of appetite. Take a history from the patient.
roleplayer: You are a 32-year-old woman. You have been feeling low for the past 6 weeks. You wake up at 4am every day and cannot get back to sleep. You have lost 4kg in weight. You feel guilty about being a burden to your family. If the doctor asks, you admit to occasional thoughts that life is not worth living, but you have made no plans. If the doctor asks directly, you deny hallucinations or delusions. You have no past psychiatric history. Your mother had depression in her 40s.

script.opening: “I just don’t feel myself anymore, doctor.”
script.mood: Elicit core depressive symptoms (mood, anhedonia, early waking, weight loss, guilt).
script.sleep: If asked about sleep → “I wake up very early and can’t get back to sleep.”
script.appetite: If asked about appetite → “I’ve lost about 4 kilos.”
script.guilt: If asked about guilt → “I feel like a burden to my family.”
